class bvcopula.distributions.SingleParamCopulaBase(theta, rotation=None, validate_args=None)¶

Bases: torch.distributions.distribution.Distribution

This abstract class represents a copula with a single parameter. :param theta: Parameter of the copula. :type theta: float :param rotation: Clockwise rotation of the copula. Can be one of the elements of

Copula.rotation_options or None. (Default: None)
theta¶

float – Parameter of the copula.

rotation¶

string – Clockwise rotation of the copula.

log_prob(samples)¶

Log of the probability density function.

rsample(size=1)¶

Generate random variates.

ppcf(samples)¶

Inverse conditional cdf on the copula. Required for sample generation using Rosenblatt transform.

expand(batch_shape)¶

Expends the batch space: adds extra dimension for MCMC sampling corresponding to sampling particles.

expand(batch_shape, _instance=None)
has_rsample = True¶
log_prob(value)
num_thetas = 1¶
ppcf(samples)
rotation_options = ['0°', '90°', '180°', '270°']¶
rsample(sample_shape=torch.Size([]))
class bvcopula.distributions.StudentTCopula(theta, rotation=None, validate_args=None)¶

Bases: bvcopula.distributions.SingleParamCopulaBase

This class represents a copula from the Student T family.

arg_constraints = {'theta': Interval(lower_bound=-1, upper_bound=1)}¶
static cdf_approx_2(x)¶
static icdf_approx_2(y)¶
static icdf_approx_3(y)¶
log_prob(value)¶
ppcf(samples)¶

all packages actually invert cdf, like R: https://github.com/SurajGupta/r-source/blob/master/src/nmath/qt.c which is not an option on GPU; There are many approximations for particular dfs, described in: William T. Shaw Sampling Student’s T distribution – use of the inverse cumulative distribution function He also describes a sampling method that oes not have to use icdf at all (Bailey’s method), which is also, unfortunatelly, iterative, meaning that it is not GPU-friendly.

For now, we’ll simply use an pproximation for df=2.0: cdf = 1/2 + x/2/sqrt(x**2+2) icdf = sign(x-0.5) * sqrt(2/(1/(2y-1)**2 - 1))

support = Interval(lower_bound=0, upper_bound=1)¶

expected_log_prob(target: torch.Tensor, input: gpytorch.distributions.multivariate_normal.MultivariateNormal, weights=None, particles=torch.Size([0]), *params: typing.Any, **kwargs: typing.Any) → torch.Tensor¶

Computes the expected log likelihood (used for variational inference): .. math:

\mathbb{E}_{f(x)} \left[ \log p \left( y \mid f(x)

ight) ight]

Args:
function_dist (gpytorch.distributions.MultivariateNormal)
Distribution for \(f(x)\).
observations (torch.Tensor)
Values of \(y\).

kwargs

Returns
torch.Tensor (log probability)
forward(function_samples: torch.Tensor, *params: typing.Any, **kwargs: typing.Any) → bvcopula.distributions.GaussianCopula¶
static gplink_function(f: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶

GP link function transforms the GP latent variable f into :math:` heta`, which parameterizes the distribution in forward method as well as the log likelihood of this distribution defined in expected_log_prob.

Bases: gpytorch.likelihoods.likelihood.Likelihood

WAIC(gp_distr: gpytorch.distributions.multivariate_normal.MultivariateNormal, target: torch.Tensor, combine_terms=True)¶
Computes WAIC

:param gp_distr: Trained Gaussian Process distribution :type gp_distr: gpytorch.distributions.MultivariateNormal :param target: Values of \(y\). :type target: torch.Tensor :param n: Number of points in input space for logprob estimation :type n: int :param length: Length of the input space in physical units (seconds/cm/…). Provides scale for derivative in FI. :type length: float

Returns
FI (Fisher information) MI (Mutual information)
expected_log_prob(target: torch.Tensor, input: gpytorch.distributions.multivariate_normal.MultivariateNormal, weights=None, particles=torch.Size([0]), *params: typing.Any, **kwargs: typing.Any) → torch.Tensor¶

Computes the expected log likelihood (used for variational inference): .. math:

\mathbb{E}_{f(x)} \left[ \log p \left( y \mid f(x)

ight) ight]

Args:
function_dist (gpytorch.distributions.MultivariateNormal)
Distribution for \(f(x)\).
observations (torch.Tensor)
Values of \(y\).

kwargs

Returns
torch.Tensor (log probability)
forward(function_samples: torch.Tensor, *params: typing.Any, **kwargs: typing.Any) → bvcopula.distributions.MixtureCopula¶
gplink_function(f: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶

GP link function transforms the GP latent variable f into :math:` heta`, which parameterizes the distribution in forward method as well as the log likelihood of this distribution defined in expected_log_prob.

input_information(model: bvcopula.models.Mixed_GPInferenceModel, samples: torch.Tensor, n: int, length: float, ignore_GP_uncertainty=False)¶
Computes Fisher Information and Mutual information

:param model: Trained Gaussian Process for copual parameter inference :type model: bvcopula.models.Mixed_GPInferenceModel :param samples: Values of \(y\). :type samples: torch.Tensor :param n: Number of points in input space for logprob estimation :type n: int :param length: Length of the input space in physical units (seconds/cm/…).

Provides scale for derivative in FI.

:type length: float :param ignore_GP_uncertainty: If True, then mean value of GP is used.

Otherwise (False), full doubly-stochastic model is used for logprob estimation.

:type ignore_GP_uncertainty: bool

Returns
FI (Fisher information) MI (Mutual information)
